pr_title: [ML] adding for_export flag for ml plugin GET resource APIs

timeline.bodyText: BTW, is there any reason for ALLOW_NO_MATCH to be ParseField rather than String?
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.bodyText: probably not, but just didn't touch the existing field :)
replies.author: benwtrent

timeline.author: przemekwitek

timeline.bodyText:
So this else block is not for making the retrieved config "puttable" but it does something more (clears defaults).
I'm wondering what happens when we ever change the code for generating the default. Then the config is indexed with default D1, then in the subsequent version we change the default to be D2 and then we retrieve the config for export and the default is not cleared (as it was the default in the past but no longer is). Is that a good behavior?
timeline.author: przemekwitek

replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText: Tough question. I guess it's better to stick to the promise that we are able to PUT the config obtained via GET with for_export...
replies.author: przemekwitek

timeline.bodyText: We should have a single method that calculates the default query delay between this one and Builder.setDefaultQueryDelay
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

timeline.bodyText: Is there a benefit to not always return the query? The query is integral to the behaviour of the datafeed. Even in the improbable scenario where we change the default query in a future release, it'd be a weird surprise to get a datafeed for_export from a previous version cluster and put it in a newer version to find out different docs are picked because the default query changed.
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou

replies.bodyText:
put it in a newer version to find out different docs are picked because the default query changed.

If we change the default query to EXCLUDE docs, I think that is a huge thing and should probably never be done.
I can happily include the query here, but it did seem unnecessary to me.
replies.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
Agreed that changing the default query sounds hard to justify :-)
But I do think we should include the query. We return it in get, so we might as well also return it for_export.
replies.author: dimitris-athanasiou

timeline.bodyText: Same here, let's avoid duplication on the default calculation. We can reuse this in the Builder.setDefaultChunkingConfig.
timeline.author: dimitris-athanasiou
